body_html:
That seems like the native library is being built for a different architecture.

Did you setup the WORKSPACE file with the appropriate SDK/NDK.
Also, you might want to try with:

bazel build -c opt --config=android_arm //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo
(notice the --config=android_arm)
body_text:
That seems like the native library is being built for a different architecture.
Did you setup the WORKSPACE file with the appropriate SDK/NDK.
Also, you might want to try with:
bazel build -c opt --config=android_arm //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo
(notice the --config=android_arm)
body:
That seems like the native library is being [built for a different architecture](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24572052/install-failed-no-matching-abis-when-install-apk).

Did you setup the `WORKSPACE` file with the appropriate SDK/NDK.
Also, you might want to try with:

`bazel build -c opt --config=android_arm //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo`
(notice the `--config=android_arm`)
